question: Which of the following is correct, in the context of a cricket game, in which the loser of each match-up is immediately eliminated from the tournament?
explanation: Single Elimination Tournament, in the context of a cricket game, is in which the loser of each match-up is immediately eliminated from the tournament. A single-elimination, knockout, or sudden death tournament is a type of elimination tournament where the loser of each match-up is immediately eliminated from the tournament. Each winner will play another in the next round, until the final match-up, whose winner becomes the tournament champion.
